channel.title: Rulemaking for my router
channel.description:
when making a rule i put my ip into the address bar and it comes up with all the speedtouch stuff and i click on advanced like mod taharok said and then he says click on advanced so i do.. then he says click on the gaming button
in my advanced bar their is no gaming button please tell me what else i could do to add this rule[br][size=1]Posted on: January 21, 2007, 07:52:22 AM[/size][hr]please? theres an admin spot for whoever helps me get online :D

item.title: Rulemaking for my router
item.dc:creator: @Gol_Goroth Gol Goroth
item.description:
@Gol_Goroth wrote:

Hmmm I used to have a speed touch modem god I wish i still had it in stead of this net gear monstrosity.

Read full topic

@lidawano wrote:

i got a speedtouch 1

Read full topic

item.title: Rulemaking for my router
item.dc:creator: @Gol_Goroth Gol Goroth
item.description:
@Gol_Goroth wrote:

[quote=“lidawano, post:5, topic:50124”]im just trying to get the rule done ill copy n paste the quote thing

Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the [glow=red,2,300]“gaming”[/glow] button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

the red bit is the part that is not in the advanced section[/quote]

What router do you have? (I have the same problem)

Read full topic

item.title: Rulemaking for my router
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Thats if your going to use no-ip, no-ip = confusing and too much work involved…
Thats why so many people use hamachi

item.title: Rulemaking for my router
item.dc:creator: @lidawano lidawano
item.description:
@lidawano wrote:

im just trying to get the rule done ill copy n paste the quote thing

Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the [glow=red,2,300]“gaming”[/glow] button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

the red bit is the part that is not in the advanced section

Read full topic
